title: BUTCHER BABIES & DED Replace OCEANO On Upcoming ATTILA's American Rejects Tour
author: Joel Barrios
byline: By Joel Barrios Published 42 minutes ago
text: Attila has revealed that Butcher Babies and Ded will replace Oceano in their upcoming 2025 America's Rejects tour, which also includes Dealer and Nathan James in the bill. In case you missed the controversy surrounding this tour, it came under fire from fans and a few other musicians due to members of both Attila and Dealer being accused of alleged sexual misconduct over the years. This resulted in extensive back-and-forth online between Oceano vocalist Adam Warren and fans, leading to Warren quitting Oceano and the band being set to break up in 2025. Now, along with the announcement, Attila has dropped a new track, coincidentally named "America's Rejects," and you can stream it below. Frontman Chris Fronzak shared his thoughts on the song and the tour's significance, explaining, "‘America's Rejects' is an anthem for anyone who's ever felt like they didn't belong — a big middle finger to the status quo. Adding Butcher Babies and Ded to this lineup takes it to a whole new level. This tour isn't just a show; it's a movement." He continued, "We're uniting the rejects, the outcasts, and anyone who's ready to throw it all in the face of the norm. 2025 is our year, and this tour is going to be a big f** you to everything holding you back!" The America's Rejects Tour starts on March 4 at Club L.A. in Destin, FL, and continues through 22 cities before culminating at The Orpheum in Tampa, FL, on April 5. The full routing is below. Tickets are available here. 3/4 Destin, FL Club LA3/7 Houston, TX Studio At Warehouse Live3/8 Dallas, TX Trees3/1 El Paso, TX Lowbrow Palace3/11 Albuquerque, NM Sunshine Theater3/13 Grand Junction, CO Mesa Theater3/14 Denver, CO Gothic Theatre3/15 Colorado Springs, CO Black Sheep3/18 Iowa City, IA Wildwood Saloon3/19 Indianapolis, IN Deluxe3/2 Chicago, IL WC Social Club3/21 Lansing, MI Grewal Hall at 2243/22 Covington, KY Madison Theater3/25 New Haven, CT Toad's Place3/26 Amityville, NJ Amityville Music Hall3/27 Scranton, PA The Ritz Theater3/28 Brooklyn, NY The Brooklyn Monarch3/29 Reading, PA Reverb3/31 Raleigh, NC Lincoln Theatre4/1 Atlanta, GA Terminal West4/2 Charleston, SC Music Farm4/4 West Palm Beach, FL The Banyan Live4/5 Tampa, FL The Orpheum Want More Metal? html:
Attila has revealed that Butcher Babies and Ded will replace Oceano in their upcoming 2025 America's Rejects tour, which also includes Dealer and Nathan James in the bill.

In case you missed the controversy surrounding this tour, it came under fire from fans and a few other musicians due to members of both Attila and Dealer being accused of alleged sexual misconduct over the years. This resulted in extensive back-and-forth online between Oceano vocalist Adam Warren and fans, leading to Warren quitting Oceano and the band being set to break up in 2025.

Now, along with the announcement, Attila has dropped a new track, coincidentally named "America's Rejects," and you can stream it below.

Frontman Chris Fronzak shared his thoughts on the song and the tour's significance, explaining, "‘America's Rejects' is an anthem for anyone who's ever felt like they didn't belong — a big middle finger to the status quo. Adding Butcher Babies and Ded to this lineup takes it to a whole new level. This tour isn't just a show; it's a movement."

He continued, "We're uniting the rejects, the outcasts, and anyone who's ready to throw it all in the face of the norm. 2025 is our year, and this tour is going to be a big f** you to everything holding you back!"

The America's Rejects Tour starts on March 4 at Club L.A. in Destin, FL, and continues through 22 cities before culminating at The Orpheum in Tampa, FL, on April 5. The full routing is below. Tickets are available here.
